properties.areaDesc: Aiken; Richmond; Calhoun; Burke; Kershaw; Barnwell; Lexington; Richland; Fairfield; Orangeburg
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 11:40AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
At 1139 AM EST...National Weather Service doppler radar indicated
strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of
Fairfield County Airport to near New Ellenton, moving east at 50 mph.

HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph.

IMPACT...expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light, unsecured objects.

Some locations in the path of these storms include...
Columbia, Aiken, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres,
Camden, Waynesboro, Springdale, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Lake Wateree
Dam, Savannah River Site, St. Andrews, Aiken Mall, Highway 6 at Lake
Murray Dam, Red Bank, Plant Vogtle and Williston.

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3.
Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 38 and 99.
Interstate 26 between mile markers 101 and 128.
Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 32.

Winds of this strength, combined with recent wet grounds, could
cause downed tress in isolated loactions.

NWSheadline: Strong Thunderstorms Will Impact Portions of northeastern Burke... southeastern Richmond...northwestern Orangeburg...southeastern Fairfield...Lexington...central Barnwell...Aiken...northwestern Calhoun...central Richland and southern Kershaw Counties Until 1230 PM EST.
